# Installer Checklist: Installation and Walking Skeleton

**Purpose**: Validate quality of installer and walking skeleton requirements for completeness, clarity, consistency, and coverage
**Created**: 2025-12-26
**Feature**: specs/002-installer-skeleton/spec.md

**Note**: This checklist is generated by the `/speckit.checklist` command based on feature context and requirements.

## Requirement Completeness

- [x] CHK001 - Are installation requirements complete for all supported platforms (macOS/Linux, Windows)? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK002 - Are all supported coding agents explicitly listed and specified? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK003 - Are script generation requirements defined for both bash and PowerShell environments? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK004 - Are prompt file requirements specified for each supported agent type? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK005 - Are template file requirements documented for the walking skeleton? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK006 - Are automated testing requirements complete for all installation and initialization flows? [Completeness, Spec §Automated Testing Documentation]

## Requirement Clarity

- [x] CHK007 - Is the uv installation process clearly specified with exact commands and paths? [Clarity, Spec §User Scenarios & Testing]
- [x] CHK008 - Are agent-specific prompt locations unambiguously defined for each coding agent? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK009 - Is sequence number determination logic clearly specified for greeting files? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK010 - Are "appropriate subfolders" and file naming conventions explicitly defined? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK011 - Is the gmkit init command interface clearly specified with all parameters? [Clarity, Spec §User Scenarios & Testing]

## Requirement Consistency

- [x] CHK012 - Are cross-platform installation requirements consistent between macOS/Linux and Windows? [Consistency, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK013 - Do script input/output requirements align across bash and PowerShell implementations? [Consistency, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK014 - Are agent prompt requirements consistent across all supported agents? [Consistency, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK015 - Do initialization requirements align with walking skeleton functionality? [Consistency, Spec §Functional Requirements]

## Acceptance Criteria Quality

- [x] CHK016 - Are success criteria measurable with specific, quantifiable metrics? [Acceptance Criteria, Spec §Success Criteria]
- [x] CHK017 - Can installation verification steps be objectively tested? [Measurability, Spec §Success Criteria]
- [x] CHK018 - Are automated test success conditions clearly defined? [Measurability, Spec §Automated Testing Documentation]
- [x] CHK019 - Can slash command functionality be verifiably tested? [Measurability, Spec §Success Criteria]

## Scenario Coverage

- [x] CHK020 - Are requirements defined for interactive prompting when optional parameters are omitted? [Coverage, Spec §User Scenarios & Testing]
- [x] CHK021 - Are slash command execution requirements specified for all supported agents? [Coverage, Spec §User Scenarios & Testing]
- [x] CHK022 - Are template filling and file writing requirements covered for greeting generation? [Coverage, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK023 - Are constitution.md generation requirements specified? [Coverage, Spec §Functional Requirements]

## Edge Case Coverage

- [x] CHK024 - Are requirements defined for invalid temp folder paths or permissions? [Edge Case, Spec §Edge Cases]
- [x] CHK025 - Is behavior specified when unsupported agent types are provided? [Edge Case, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK026 - Are requirements defined for sequence number conflicts or missing greeting directories? [Edge Case, Spec §Edge Cases] - Now specifies directory creation and concurrent access handling
- [x] CHK027 - Is behavior specified when uv installation fails or PATH is misconfigured? [Edge Case, Spec §Edge Cases]

## Non-Functional Requirements

- [x] CHK028 - Are idempotency requirements clearly defined for gmkit init re-runs? [Non-Functional, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK029 - Are error message requirements specified with actionable guidance? [Non-Functional, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK030 - Are performance requirements defined for installation and initialization? [Non-Functional, Spec §Success Criteria]
- [x] CHK031 - Are no-network requirements specified for post-installation flows? [Non-Functional, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK032 - Are no-external-dependency requirements specified for TOML validation? [Non-Functional, Spec §Functional Requirements - FR-017]

## Dependencies & Assumptions

- [x] CHK032 - Are uv tool dependencies and prerequisites documented? [Dependencies, Spec §Technical Constraints]
- [x] CHK033 - Are assumptions about PATH configuration validated in requirements? [Assumption, Spec §Edge Cases]
- [x] CHK034 - Are external agent tool assumptions documented and tested? [Dependencies, Spec §Functional Requirements] - Now includes validation requirement and test

## TOML Validation Requirements

- [x] CHK035 - Are TOML file generation requirements specified for gemini and qwen agents? [Completeness, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK036 - Is TOML validation using built-in tomllib library explicitly required? [Validation, Spec §Functional Requirements - FR-017]
- [x] CHK037 - Are error handling requirements defined for invalid TOML generation? [Edge Case, Spec §Edge Cases]
- [x] CHK038 - Are single-source template requirements documented (markdown as source, TOML as generated)? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]

## Agent Format Specifications

- [x] CHK039 - Are agent-specific file formats clearly specified (.md vs .toml)? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK040 - Are agent-specific folder paths unambiguously defined (.claude/commands/, .codex/prompts/, etc.)? [Clarity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK041 - Are file extension requirements consistent across all agent configurations? [Consistency, Spec §Functional Requirements]

## Ambiguities & Conflicts

- [x] CHK042 - Are any vague terms like "latest sequence number" quantified with specific logic? [Ambiguity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK043 - Do installation requirements conflict between macOS/Linux and Windows layouts? [Conflict, Spec §Functional Requirements]
- [x] CHK044 - Are "appropriate subfolders" consistently defined across all contexts? [Ambiguity, Spec §Functional Requirements]
